New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers tied their best start in franchise history with an 8-0 record.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland scored 39 points, his best scoring night in nearly two years, while matching Damian Lillard shot for shot.
Evan Mobley showcased his skills with a block, full-court dribble, and thunderous dunk early in the second quarter.
The Cavaliers defeated the Milwaukee Bucks 116-114.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers and the Oklahoma City Thunder are considered the two best teams in the league right now.
The Bucks were without Giannis Antetokounmpo for the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Cavs coach Kenny Atkinson noted the team's quiet confidence and humility.
Donovan Mitchell and Kenny Atkinson downplayed the significance of the 8-0 start, focusing on greater aspirations.
The Cavaliers' locker room is described as full of laughter and smiles, with a sense of belonging and rising power.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last time the Cavaliers started a season 8-0 was 48 years ago.
The Milwaukee Bucks started 9-0 two years ago but were eliminated in the first round of the playoffs.
Browns owner Jimmy Haslam, who also owns the Bucks, watched the first half of the game but was not seen during the second half.
Others: The Cavaliers have locked up most of their roster with long-term deals, reducing financial stress and contract pressure.
